question_text: A radioactive sample has a decay constant of 0.005 s⁻¹. How many nuclei remain after 60 seconds from an initial amount of 2.0 × 10⁶ nuclei?
A source has an activity of 2500 Bq and contains 5.0 × 10⁶ undecayed nuclei. What is its decay constant?
A sample has a half-life of 5 minutes. What percentage of the original nuclei remains after 20 minutes?
The activity of a radioactive source decreases from 1600 Bq to 100 Bq in 30 minutes. Estimate the half-life of the substance.
